docs.snippet: Valentino is a fan of the River Plate soccer club who dreams of dodging down the field like Argentine star Lionel Messi. Adrian wants to score goals like his hero, former Boca Juniors standout Martin Palermo. Eugenia and Sofia just want to have fu...
docs.lead_paragraph: Valentino is a fan of the River Plate soccer club who dreams of dodging down the field like Argentine star Lionel Messi. Adrian wants to score goals like his hero, former Boca Juniors standout Martin Palermo. Eugenia and Sofia just want to have fun with the ball.

headline.main: AP PHOTOS: 'Golazo!' Disabled Kids Revel in Soccer
headline.print_headline: AP PHOTOS: 'Golazo!' Disabled Kids Revel in Soccer

docs.snippet: Extremists are carving out pockets of territory for Islamist militants, posing what intelligence officials say may become the greatest security threat in the world today....
docs.lead_paragraph: Extremists are carving out pockets of territory for Islamist militants, posing what intelligence officials say may become the greatest security threat in the world today.
docs.abstract: Extremists are carving out pockets of territory in Syria for Islamist militants, posing what intelligence officials say may become the greatest security threat in the world; counterterrorism officials worry that a new affiliate of Al Qaeda could be emerging.

headline.main: As Foreign Fighters Flood Syria, Fears of a New Extremist Haven
headline.print_headline: Militants Flood Havens in Syria, Posing a Threat

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Raqqa, Syria.
